response:
<<<api>>>: Activity.findViewById
<<<code>>>: heart_icon=(ImageButton)activity.findViewById(R.id.heart_icon);
<<<explanation>>>: In the AnimationClass, you are extending the MainActivity class, which means you are trying to access the views (heart_icon and bee_icon) from the MainActivity layout. However, since you are trying to put the animation methods in a different class, you need to pass the activity context to the loadAnimations method and use that context to find the views using findViewById. So, you need to modify the code in the onCreate method of AnimationClass as follows:

public void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState) {
    super.onCreate(savedInstanceState);
    setContentView(R.layout.activity_main); // Set the layout for AnimationClass
    heart_icon=(ImageButton)findViewById(R.id.heart_icon);
    bee_icon = (ImageButton)findViewById(R.id.bee_icon);
}

And modify the loadAnimations method as follows:

public static void loadAnimations(Activity activity){
    anim_heart = AnimationUtils.loadAnimation(activity, R.anim.heart_anim);
    heart_icon.startAnimation(anim_heart);
    anim_bee = AnimationUtils.loadAnimation(activity, R.anim.bee_anim);
    bee_icon.startAnimation(anim_bee);
}

Also, make sure that you have the correct layout file (activity_main.xml) for AnimationClass, which contains the heart_icon and bee_icon views.
